required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Use of Deferasirox as Compared to Deferoxamine in Treating Cardiac Iron Overload
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Open-label Phase II Trial Evaluating Deferasirox Compared With Deferoxamine in Patients With Cardiac Iron Overload Due to Chronic Blood Transfusions

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a clinical research study in patients who have iron overload in the heart due to chronic blood transfusions.
The study will have 2 treatment groups and will compare the safety and efficacy of chelation therapy with a medicine called deferasirox (ICL670) with another medicine called deferoxamine (DFO). The study is aimed at finding out which of the two medicines is the best for treating iron overload in the heart.
Patients will be treated for 12 months (core study phase). Patients who complete the core study phase will be offered to continue their study treatment in a 12 months extension phase. During the core and extension, the effects of treatment on iron overload in the heart and the liver will be evaluated using specific magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) assessments.

primary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Change From Baseline in Myocardial T2* (Magnetic Resonance T2-star (T2*) Technique for the Measurement of Tissue Iron) After 12 Months Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Non- inferiority in efficacy of deferasirox compared to deferoxamine (DFO) in treating cardiac iron overload as measured by T2*. A non-inferiority margin of 0.9 (90%) was applied. Due to limitations in performing heart biopsies, T2* (T2 star), a Magnetic Resonance (MR) relaxation parameter expressed in milliseconds, as is an important tool to noninvasively quantify cardiac iron concentration. Studies have shown that myocardial T2* evaluations may predict cardiac events, e.g., impaired (<56%) left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) is prevalent among patients with low T2*: found in 62% of patients with T2*<8 ms; 20% with T2* of 8-12 ms; and in 5% with T2* >12 ms (Tanner 2006)

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Cardiac Function After 12 Months of Treatment With Deferasirox vs. Deferoxamine, by Change in Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF)
secondary_outcome.description: An absolute change from baseline in LVEF after 12 months treatment with deferasirox and compared to.DFO was tested using an analysis of covariance model including baseline left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) as a covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Cardiac Function After 6 Months of Treatment With Deferasirox vs. Deferoxamine, by Change in Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF)
secondary_outcome.description: An absolute change from baseline in LVEF after 6 months treatment with deferasirox and DFO was summarized

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Change From Baseline in Myocardial T2* After 6 Months Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Summary statistics of T2* ratio Month 6/baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Cardiac Function After 6 and 12 Months Treatment With Deferasirox vs. Deferoxamine, by Change in Left Ventricular End Systolic Volume Indices (LVESVI)
secondary_outcome.description: An absolute change from baseline in LVESVI after 6 and 12 months treatment with deferasirox and DFO was summarized. Changes in cardiovascular magnetic resonance (CMR) measured left ventricular end systolic after 6 and 12 months treatment. Left ventricular (LV) end-systolic volume indexed to body surface area (ESVI) is a simple yet powerful echocardiographic marker of LV remodeling that can be measured easily. Left ventricular (LV) end-systolic volume (ESV) has been shown to be an important determinant of survival after myocardial infarction (MI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Core Study: Cardiac Function After 6 and 12 Months of Treatment With Deferasirox vs. Deferoxamine, by Change in Left Ventricular End Diastolic Volume Indices (LVEDVI)
secondary_outcome.description: An absolute change from baseline in LVEDVI after 6, and 12 months treatment with deferasirox and DFO was summarized

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Cardiac Function After 6 and 12 Months of Treatment With Deferasirox vs. Deferoxamine, by Change in Left Ventricular Mass Indices (LVMI)
secondary_outcome.description: An absolute change from baseline in LVMI after 6, and 12 months treatment with deferasirox and DFO was summarized

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Cardiac Function and the Proportion of Patients Dropping Out Due to Cardiac Dysfunction After Treatment With Deferasirox vs. Deferoxamine
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients withdrawn from the study due to LVEF <50%, T2* <6 ms or significant decreases in T2* ≥ 33% from baseline was provided per treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Safety and Tolerability of Deferasirox vs Deferoxamine Over the 12 Months Treatment Period.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with adverse events, serious adverse events and death

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Single and Repeated Dose Pharmacokinetics of Deferasirox, Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve for a Dosing Interval (AUCtau)
secondary_outcome.description: The plasma level of deferasirox (ICL670) obtained in this study was summarized descriptively. Plasma concentration was plotted by patient and by visit. Descriptive statistics included the mean, median, SD, and CV, min and max. deferasirox pharmacokinetics (PK) trough levels over the 12 months of treatment and obtained PK profiles for the 40 mg/kg/day deferasirox dose, area under the plasma concentration-time curve for a dosing interval (AUCtau)

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Single and Repeated Dose Pharmacokinetics of Deferasirox, Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.description: The plasma level of deferasirox (ICL670) obtained in this study was summarized descriptively. Plasma concentration was plotted by patient and by visit. Descriptive statistics included the mean, median, SD, and CV, min and max. deferasirox pharmacokinetics (PK) trough levels over the 12 months of treatment and obtained PK profiles for the 40 mg/kg/day deferasirox dose, maximum plasma concentration (Cmax)

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Single and Repeated Dose Pharmacokinetics of Deferasirox, Time Points of Concentration Data
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1 and month 2 (pre-dose, 1,2 and 4 hours post-dose)
secondary_outcome.description: The plasma level of deferasirox (ICL670) obtained in this study was summarized descriptively. Plasma concentration was plotted by patient and by visit. For trough concentration assessments, a 2-mL blood sample was to be taken on arrival at the study site, i.e. prior to the patient receiving the daily deferasirox dose (pre-dose blood sample). A second 2-mL blood sample was to be taken 2 hours later (post-dose sample). At all other visits (Visits 3 - 14), a pre-dose sample was to be taken. For PK profile assessments, 3 blood samples were taken after 1, 2, and 4 hours post-dose in addition to the 2-mL pre-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Change From Baseline in Myocardial T2* After 24 Months Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The measured T2* values, the ratio (post-baseline / baseline T2*) at Month 6, 12, 18 and 24 was summarized for FAS population along with two-sided 95% CIs. The geometric means of the ratio was presented for all treatment groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Cardiac Function From Baseline to Month 24 by Change in Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF)
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac function endpoints (LVEF) obtained by CMR at baseline, Months 6, 12, 18 and 24 were summarized by means of descriptive statistics. These analyses were conducted for the measured values as well as for the absolute changes from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Cardiac Function From Baseline to Month 24 by Change in Left Ventricular End Systolic Volume Indices (LVESVI)
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac function endpoints (LVESVI) obtained by CMR at baseline, Months 6, 12, 18 and 24 were summarized by means of descriptive statistics. These analyses were conducted for the measured values as well as for the absolute changes from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Cardiac Function From Baseline to Month 24 by Change in Left Ventricular End Diastolic Volume Indices (LVEDVI)
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac function endpoint (LVEDVI ) obtained by CMR at baseline, Months 6, 12, 18 and 24 were summarized by means of descriptive statistics. These analyses were conducted for the measured values as well as for the absolute changes from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Cardiac Function From Baseline to Month 24 by Change in Left Ventricular Mass Indices (LVMI)
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac function endpoints (LVMI) obtained by CMR at baseline, Months 6, 12, 18 and 24 were summarized by means of descriptive statistics. These analyses were conducted for the measured values as well as for the absolute changes

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: The Cardiac Iron Concentration From T2* Values
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac iron concentration (derived from T2* values) at baseline, Months 6, 12, 18 and 24 were summarized by descriptive statistics. The absolute change from baseline at Months 6, 12, 18 and 24 were also summarized by treatment group. Lliver iron concentration is expressed in units (mg of iron / g of liver tissue dry weight (dw)

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: Results of liver iron content (LIC) measurements by MRI was summarized by descriptive statistics. The absolute value and the absolute change from baseline in LIC at Months 6, 12, 18 and 24 were provided by treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Extension Study: Change in Serum Ferritin From Baseline by Month
secondary_outcome.description: Serum ferritin values was summarized by descriptive statistics. Absolute value and the absolute change from baseline in serum ferritin by month was provided by treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Core Study: Single and Repeated Dose Pharmacokinetics of Deferasirox, Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.description: The plasma level of deferasirox (ICL670) obtained in this study was summarized descriptively. Plasma concentration was plotted by patient and by visit. Descriptive statistics included the mean, median, SD, and CV, min and max. deferasirox pharmacokinetics (PK) trough levels over the 12 months of treatment and obtained PK profiles for the 40 mg/kg/day deferasirox dose, time to reach maximum plasma concentration (Tmax)

arm_group.description: 20 mg/kg/day once daily (od) for 2 weeks, followed by 30 mg/kg/day od for 1 week and a subsequent continuation of 40 mg/kg/day
50 mg/kg/day to 60 mg/kg/day infused subcutaneously in 8- to 12-hour intervals administered 5 to 7 days/week
"DFO to ICL" (patients who switched from DFO to deferasirox in extension)
"ICL to DFO" (patients who switched from deferasirox to DFO in extension)

intervention.description: 20 mg/kg/day once daily (od) for 2 weeks, followed by 30 mg/kg/day od for 1 week and a subsequent continuation of 40 mg/kg/day
50 mg/kg/day to 60 mg/kg/day infused subcutaneously in 8- to 12-hour intervals administered 5 to 7 days/week
40 mg/kg deferasirox once daily administered 30 minutes before taking food.
DFO at a target range of 50 mg/kg/day to 60 mg/kg/day via subcutaneous (sc) infusion lasting a period of 8 to 12 hrs administered for 5 to 7 days per week,

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Male or female patients, aged 10 years and above, with β-thalassemia major or DBA or sideroblastic anemia on chronic transfusion therapy, having given written consent to participate in the study.
- Patients with cardiac iron as measured by a myocardial T2* value that is ≥ 6ms but not ≥ 20 ms.
- Patients with a lifetime history of at least 50 units of red cell transfusions, and must be receiving at least ≥10 units/yr of red blood cells transfusions.
- Patients with a left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) ≥ 56 % as determined by cardiovascular magnetic resonance (CMR).
- Patients with liver iron content (LIC) value ≥ 3 mg Fe / g dw, as determined by liver MRI.
Exclusion criteria:
- Patients with clinical symptoms of cardiac dysfunction.
- Patients unable to undergo study assessments including MRI
- Patients participating in another clinical trial or receiving an investigational drug.
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

clinical_study.keyword: MDS (low and INT-1 risk as per the IPSS for MDS)

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients randomized to 1 of 2 treatment grps ICL or DFO, 20 mg/kg/day once daily for 2 wks, followed by 30 mg/kg/day od for 1 wk and 40 mg/kg/day od (DFO) target dose of 50 to 60 mg/kg/day 8 to 12 hour for 5 to 7 days/wk. In ext. pts could either stay in the same grp from core or could switch grps: ICL to ICL, DFO to DFO, DFO to ICL and ICL to DFO

group.title: Deferasirox (ICL). For Extension Labeled as ICL to ICL
group.description: 20 mg/kg/day once daily (od) for 2 weeks, followed by 30 mg/kg/day od for 1 week and a subsequent continuation of 40 mg/kg/day

group.title: Deferoxamine (DFO). For Extension Labeled as DFO to DFO
group.description: 50 mg/kg/day to 60 mg/kg/day infused subcutaneously in 8- to 12-hour intervals administered 5 to 7 days/week

group.title: DFO to ICL (Deferoxamine to Deferasirox)
group.description: DFO to ICL” (patients who switched from DFO to deferasirox in extension)

group.title: ICL to DFO (Deferasirox to Deferoxamine)
group.description: ICL to DFO” (patients who switched from deferasirox to DFO in extension)

participants_list.participants: Of the 82 patients who completed the ICL core, 74 continued on the ICL ext. phase; 1 went to ICL-DFO
Of the 78 patients who completed the DFO core, 29 went on DFO ext. phase; 42 went to the DFO-ICL
Of the 78 patients who completed the DFO core, 29 went on DFO ext. phase; 42 went to the DFO-ICL
Of the 82 patients who completed the ICL core, 74 continued on the ICL ext. phase; 1 went to ICL-DFO
1 patient did not receive drug in the ext. phase but received drug in the core phase

baseline.population: Per Protocol Set (PPS): randomized patients who received at least 6 months of study drug, had a T2* value assessed at least 150 days after randomization, and had no major protocol deviations. A total of 25 patients (7 in the deferasirox arm and 18 in the DFO arm) were excluded from PPS

group.description: 20 mg/kg/day once daily (od) for 2 weeks, followed by 30 mg/kg/day od for 1 week and a subsequent continuation of 40 mg/kg/day

group.title: Core: Deferoxamine (DFO)
group.description: 50 mg/kg/day to 60 mg/kg/day infused subcutaneously in 8- to 12-hour intervals administered 5 to 7 days/week

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

Gender

outcome.title: Core Study: Change From Baseline in Myocardial T2* (Magnetic Resonance T2-star (T2*) Technique for the Measurement of Tissue Iron) After 12 Months Treatment
outcome.description: Non- inferiority in efficacy of deferasirox compared to deferoxamine (DFO) in treating cardiac iron overload as measured by T2*. A non-inferiority margin of 0.9 (90%) was applied. Due to limitations in performing heart biopsies, T2* (T2 star), a Magnetic Resonance (MR) relaxation parameter expressed in milliseconds, as is an important tool to noninvasively quantify cardiac iron concentration. Studies have shown that myocardial T2* evaluations may predict cardiac events, e.g., impaired (<56%) left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) is prevalent among patients with low T2*: found in 62% of patients with T2*<8 ms; 20% with T2* of 8-12 ms; and in 5% with T2* >12 ms (Tanner 2006)
outcome.population: Per Protocol Set (PPS) consisted of all randomized patients who received at least 6 months of randomized study drug, had a T2* value assessed at least 150 days after randomization, adhered to the major inclusion and none of the major exclusion criteria, and had no major protocol deviations.

outcome.title: Core Study: Cardiac Function After 6 and 12 Months Treatment With Deferasirox vs. Deferoxamine, by Change in Left Ventricular End Systolic Volume Indices (LVESVI)
outcome.description: An absolute change from baseline in LVESVI after 6 and 12 months treatment with deferasirox and DFO was summarized. Changes in cardiovascular magnetic resonance (CMR) measured left ventricular end systolic after 6 and 12 months treatment. Left ventricular (LV) end-systolic volume indexed to body surface area (ESVI) is a simple yet powerful echocardiographic marker of LV remodeling that can be measured easily. Left ventricular (LV) end-systolic volume (ESV) has been shown to be an important determinant of survival after myocardial infarction (MI)
outcome.population: Per Protocol Set (PPS) consisted of all randomized patients who received at least 6 months of randomized study drug, had a T2* value assessed at least 150 days after randomization, adhered to the major inclusion and none of the major exclusion criteria, and had no major protocol deviations

outcome.description: Number of patients with adverse events, serious adverse events and death
outcome.population: Safety Set (SS) consisted of all randomized patients who received at least one dose of study drug and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. Patients were analyzed according to treatment received. Treatment received is defined as first study drug administered

class.title: Death. None were considered related to study drug.

outcome.title: Core Study: Single and Repeated Dose Pharmacokinetics of Deferasirox, Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve for a Dosing Interval (AUCtau)
outcome.description: The plasma level of deferasirox (ICL670) obtained in this study was summarized descriptively. Plasma concentration was plotted by patient and by visit. Descriptive statistics included the mean, median, SD, and CV, min and max. deferasirox pharmacokinetics (PK) trough levels over the 12 months of treatment and obtained PK profiles for the 40 mg/kg/day deferasirox dose, area under the plasma concentration-time curve for a dosing interval (AUCtau)
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set (PAS): PAS 2: All randomized patients who received the same dose of deferasirox for at least four consecutive days prior to PK sample collection and completed PK sample collection specified in the protocol at Visit 3 or Visit 4 (pre-dose, 1, 2, and 4 hours post-dose).

group.title: Deferasirox (ICL). For Extension Labeled as ICL to ICL
group.description: 20 mg/kg/day once daily (od) for 2 weeks, followed by 30 mg/kg/day od for 1 week and a subsequent continuation of 40 mg/kg/day

measure.title: Core Study: Single and Repeated Dose Pharmacokinetics of Deferasirox, Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve for a Dosing Interval (AUCtau)
measure.description: The plasma level of deferasirox (ICL670) obtained in this study was summarized descriptively. Plasma concentration was plotted by patient and by visit. Descriptive statistics included the mean, median, SD, and CV, min and max. deferasirox pharmacokinetics (PK) trough levels over the 12 months of treatment and obtained PK profiles for the 40 mg/kg/day deferasirox dose, area under the plasma concentration-time curve for a dosing interval (AUCtau)
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set (PAS): PAS 2: All randomized patients who received the same dose of deferasirox for at least four consecutive days prior to PK sample collection and completed PK sample collection specified in the protocol at Visit 3 or Visit 4 (pre-dose, 1, 2, and 4 hours post-dose).

outcome.title: Core Study: Single and Repeated Dose Pharmacokinetics of Deferasirox, Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
outcome.description: The plasma level of deferasirox (ICL670) obtained in this study was summarized descriptively. Plasma concentration was plotted by patient and by visit. Descriptive statistics included the mean, median, SD, and CV, min and max. deferasirox pharmacokinetics (PK) trough levels over the 12 months of treatment and obtained PK profiles for the 40 mg/kg/day deferasirox dose, maximum plasma concentration (Cmax)
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set (PAS): PAS 2: All randomized patients who received the same dose of deferasirox for at least four consecutive days prior to PK sample collection and completed PK sample collection specified in the protocol at Visit 3 or Visit 4 (pre-dose, 1, 2, and 4 hours post-dose).

group.title: Deferasirox (ICL). For Extension Labeled as ICL to ICL
group.description: 20 mg/kg/day once daily (od) for 2 weeks, followed by 30 mg/kg/day od for 1 week and a subsequent continuation of 40 mg/kg/day

measure.title: Core Study: Single and Repeated Dose Pharmacokinetics of Deferasirox, Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
measure.description: The plasma level of deferasirox (ICL670) obtained in this study was summarized descriptively. Plasma concentration was plotted by patient and by visit. Descriptive statistics included the mean, median, SD, and CV, min and max. deferasirox pharmacokinetics (PK) trough levels over the 12 months of treatment and obtained PK profiles for the 40 mg/kg/day deferasirox dose, maximum plasma concentration (Cmax)
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set (PAS): PAS 2: All randomized patients who received the same dose of deferasirox for at least four consecutive days prior to PK sample collection and completed PK sample collection specified in the protocol at Visit 3 or Visit 4 (pre-dose, 1, 2, and 4 hours post-dose).

outcome.title: Core Study: Single and Repeated Dose Pharmacokinetics of Deferasirox, Time Points of Concentration Data
outcome.description: The plasma level of deferasirox (ICL670) obtained in this study was summarized descriptively. Plasma concentration was plotted by patient and by visit. For trough concentration assessments, a 2-mL blood sample was to be taken on arrival at the study site, i.e. prior to the patient receiving the daily deferasirox dose (pre-dose blood sample). A second 2-mL blood sample was to be taken 2 hours later (post-dose sample). At all other visits (Visits 3 - 14), a pre-dose sample was to be taken. For PK profile assessments, 3 blood samples were taken after 1, 2, and 4 hours post-dose in addition to the 2-mL pre-dose
outcome.time_frame: Month 1 and month 2 (pre-dose, 1,2 and 4 hours post-dose)
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set (PAS): PAS 2: All randomized patients who received the same dose of deferasirox for at least four consecutive days prior to PK sample collection and completed PK sample collection specified in the protocol at Visit 3 or Visit 4 (pre-dose, 1, 2, and 4 hours post-dose).

group.title: Deferasirox (ICL). For Extension Labeled as ICL to ICL
group.description: 20 mg/kg/day once daily (od) for 2 weeks, followed by 30 mg/kg/day od for 1 week and a subsequent continuation of 40 mg/kg/day

measure.title: Core Study: Single and Repeated Dose Pharmacokinetics of Deferasirox, Time Points of Concentration Data
measure.description: The plasma level of deferasirox (ICL670) obtained in this study was summarized descriptively. Plasma concentration was plotted by patient and by visit. For trough concentration assessments, a 2-mL blood sample was to be taken on arrival at the study site, i.e. prior to the patient receiving the daily deferasirox dose (pre-dose blood sample). A second 2-mL blood sample was to be taken 2 hours later (post-dose sample). At all other visits (Visits 3 - 14), a pre-dose sample was to be taken. For PK profile assessments, 3 blood samples were taken after 1, 2, and 4 hours post-dose in addition to the 2-mL pre-dose
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set (PAS): PAS 2: All randomized patients who received the same dose of deferasirox for at least four consecutive days prior to PK sample collection and completed PK sample collection specified in the protocol at Visit 3 or Visit 4 (pre-dose, 1, 2, and 4 hours post-dose).

outcome.title: Extension Study: Change From Baseline in Myocardial T2* After 24 Months Treatment
outcome.description: The measured T2* values, the ratio (post-baseline / baseline T2*) at Month 6, 12, 18 and 24 was summarized for FAS population along with two-sided 95% CIs. The geometric means of the ratio was presented for all treatment groups
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consisted of all patients enrolled in the extension. Patients were analyzed according to the treatment they were assigned to in the beginning of the extension phase.

group.title: Extension : ICL to ICL
group.description: Patients from core continued and received same dose 20 mg/kg/day once daily (od) for 2 weeks, followed by 30 mg/kg/day od for 1 week and a subsequent continuation of 40 mg/kg/day

group.title: Extension: DFO to DFO
group.description: Patients from core continued and received same 50 mg/kg/day to 60 mg/kg/day infused subcutaneously in 8- to 12-hour intervals administered 5 to 7 days/week

group.title: Extension; DFO to ICL
group.description: DFO to ICL” (patients who switched from DFO to deferasirox in extension)

group.title: Extension: ICL to DFO
group.description: ICL to DFO” (patients who switched from deferasirox to DFO in extension)

outcome.title: Extension Study: Cardiac Function From Baseline to Month 24 by Change in Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF)
outcome.description: Cardiac function endpoints (LVEF) obtained by CMR at baseline, Months 6, 12, 18 and 24 were summarized by means of descriptive statistics. These analyses were conducted for the measured values as well as for the absolute changes from baseline
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consisted of all patients enrolled in the extension. Patients were analyzed according to the treatment they were assigned to in the beginning of the extension phase. Cardiac function parameters over time - excluding patients in Egypt sites.

outcome.title: Extension Study: The Cardiac Iron Concentration From T2* Values
outcome.description: Cardiac iron concentration (derived from T2* values) at baseline, Months 6, 12, 18 and 24 were summarized by descriptive statistics. The absolute change from baseline at Months 6, 12, 18 and 24 were also summarized by treatment group. Lliver iron concentration is expressed in units (mg of iron / g of liver tissue dry weight (dw)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consisted of all patients enrolled in the extension. Patients were analyzed according to the treatment they were assigned to in the beginning of the extension phase

outcome.title: Extension Study: Change in Liver Iron Concentration (LIC) From Baseline at Month 24

outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): consisted of all patients enrolled in the extension. Patients were analyzed according to the treatment they were assigned to in the beginning of the extension phase

outcome.title: Core Study: Single and Repeated Dose Pharmacokinetics of Deferasirox, Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
outcome.description: The plasma level of deferasirox (ICL670) obtained in this study was summarized descriptively. Plasma concentration was plotted by patient and by visit. Descriptive statistics included the mean, median, SD, and CV, min and max. deferasirox pharmacokinetics (PK) trough levels over the 12 months of treatment and obtained PK profiles for the 40 mg/kg/day deferasirox dose, time to reach maximum plasma concentration (Tmax)
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set (PAS): PAS 2: All randomized patients who received the same dose of deferasirox for at least four consecutive days prior to PK sample collection and completed PK sample collection specified in the protocol at Visit 3 or Visit 4 (pre-dose, 1, 2, and 4 hours post-dose).

Descriptive statistics included the mean, median, SD, and CV, min and max. deferasirox pharmacokinetics (PK) trough levels over the 12 months of treatment and obtained PK profiles for the 40 mg/kg/day deferasirox dose, time to reach maximum plasma concentration (Tmax)

reported_events.desc: Core : The safety set consisted of all randomized patients who received at least one dose of study drug and had at least one post-baseline. safety assessment. Extension: one patient assigned to the deferasirox arm died before receiving treatment in the extension phase

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial or disclosure of trial results in their entirety
